posts.title: Did You Know? Dolphins Have Names
posts.content: Dolphins have unique whistles that act like names, allowing them to call each other individually.

posts.title: Did You Know? Octopuses Have Three Hearts
posts.content: Octopuses have three hearts. Two pump blood to the gills and one pumps it to the rest of the body.

posts.title: Did You Know? Elephants Can Hear With Their Feet
posts.content: Elephants detect subsonic vibrations through their feet, allowing long-distance communication.

posts.title: Did You Know? A Group of Flamingos Is Called a 'Flamboyance'
posts.content: Flamingos gather in large groups called flamboyances, sometimes containing thousands of birds.

posts.title: Did You Know? Sea Otters Hold Hands While Sleeping
posts.content: Sea otters hold hands in floating groups called 'rafts' to prevent drifting apart while they sleep.

posts.title: Did You Know? Cows Have Best Friends
posts.content: Cows form close bonds with certain herd mates and become stressed when separated from them.

posts.title: Did You Know? Penguins Propose With Pebbles
posts.content: Male penguins present a pebble to a female as a way of proposing, and she accepts it as a gift.

posts.title: Did You Know? Turtles Can Breathe Through Their Butts
posts.content: Some turtles can absorb oxygen directly through specialized areas near their cloaca during hibernation underwater.

posts.title: Did You Know? Wombat Poop Is Cube-Shaped
posts.content: Wombats produce cube-shaped feces to mark territory without it rolling away.

posts.title: Did You Know? Sloths Can Hold Their Breath Longer Than Dolphins
posts.content: Sloths can slow their heart rate and hold their breath for up to 40 minutes underwater, longer than dolphins.

posts.title: Did You Know? Owls Can Rotate Their Heads 270°
posts.content: Owls have extra neck vertebrae allowing them to rotate their heads up to 270 degrees without injury.

posts.title: Did You Know? Starfish Can Regrow Arms
posts.content: Starfish can regenerate lost arms, and in some cases, an entire new starfish can grow from one arm.

posts.title: Did You Know? Horses Sleep Standing Up
posts.content: Horses can lock their leg joints to sleep while standing, though they lie down for deep sleep occasionally.

posts.title: Did You Know? Kangaroos Cannot Walk Backwards
posts.content: Due to their muscular tail and large feet, kangaroos are unable to move backward easily.

posts.title: Did You Know? Bees Can Recognize Human Faces
posts.content: Bees can learn to recognize and remember human faces, which helps them navigate and identify flowers.

posts.title: Did You Know? Crocodiles Cannot Stick Out Their Tongues
posts.content: Crocodiles’ tongues are attached to the roof of their mouths, making it impossible for them to stick them out.

posts.title: Did You Know? Giraffes Have Blue Tongues
posts.content: Giraffes have dark blue or purple tongues, which help protect against sunburn while feeding.

posts.title: Did You Know? Chameleons Can Move Eyes Independently
posts.content: Chameleons can rotate and focus their eyes independently to observe two different objects at once.

posts.title: Did You Know? Frogs Drink Through Their Skin
posts.content: Frogs can absorb water directly through their skin, so they don’t need to drink using their mouths.

posts.title: Did You Know? Rabbits Have Nearly 360° Vision
posts.content: Rabbits’ large eyes allow them to see nearly all around them, with only a small blind spot in front of their noses.
